alert.note: Alert for Graham; Sheridan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 11:54PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Kansas, including the following counties, Graham and Sheridan. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1154 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... MIdway Draw, Jackson Branch, Southwest Fork County Line Creek, South Fork Solomon River, Leeds Draw, South Martin Creek, North Creek, Southeast Fork County Line Creek, North Fork Saline River, East Creek, Midway Draw, Brush Creek, Sand Creek, Turner Draw, Cow Draw, Museum Creek, County Line Creek, Happy Creek, Gove Creek, Saline River and Rock Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morland, Saint Peter, Studley, Tasco and Penokee. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
